quotes.Quote: The wind is a very difficult sound to get. It is always changing.
quotes.Author: Maurice Jarre

quotes.Quote: Listen to the wind, it talks. Listen to the silence, it speaks. Listen to your heart, it knows.
quotes.Author: Native American Proverb

quotes.Quote: The flute of the infinite is played without ceasing, and its sound is love.
quotes.Author: Kabir

quotes.Quote: Be like the bird, who halting in his flight on limb too slight, feels it give way beneath him, yet sings, knowing he hath wings.
quotes.Author: Victor Hugo

quotes.Quote: A bird does not sing because it has an answer. It sings because it has a song.
quotes.Author: Chinese Proverb

quotes.Quote: The Ney flute when it's played, doesn't play music, it's telling a tale.
quotes.Author: Rumi

quotes.Quote: Softness is not weakness. It takes courage to stay delicate in a world this cruel.
quotes.Author: Beau Taplin

quotes.Quote: The sound of the wind is whispering in your ear, can you feel it coming back?
quotes.Author: Bob Dylan

quotes.Quote: The bluebird carries the sky on his back.
quotes.Author: Henry David Thoreau

quotes.Quote: The wind plays its own music.
quotes.Author: Bert McCoy

quotes.Quote: Every bird, every tree, every flower reminds me what a blessing and privilege it is just to be alive.
quotes.Author: Marty Rubin

quotes.Quote: The flute is not an instrument that has a sound of its own. It's the breath of the player that brings it to life.
quotes.Author: Deepak Chopra

quotes.Quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
quotes.Author: Rabindranath Tagore

quotes.Quote: The voice of the sea speaks to the soul. The touch of the sea is sensuous, enfolding the body in its soft, close embrace.
quotes.Author: Kate Chopin

quotes.Quote: The bird is powered by its own life and by its motivation.
quotes.Author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

quotes.Quote: Music is the divine way to tell beautiful, poetic things to the heart.
quotes.Author: Pablo Casals

quotes.Quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.Author: Socrates

quotes.Quote: The wind whispers secrets in its own incomprehensible language.
quotes.Author: Tracy Rees

quotes.Quote: The Ney speaks of separation from the reed bed, a symbol of our separation from the divine.
quotes.Author: Rumi

quotes.Quote: Nature's music is never over; her silences are pauses, not conclusions.
quotes.Author: Mary Webb

quotes.Quote: The wind has a language, I would I could learn!
quotes.Author: George MacDonald

quotes.Quote: Softness conquers hardness, weakness conquers strength. What is more malleable is always superior over that which is immovable.
quotes.Author: Lao Tzu

quotes.Quote: In every walk with nature, one receives far more than he seeks.
quotes.Author: John Muir

quotes.Quote: Birds sing after a storm; why shouldn't people feel as free to delight in whatever sunlight remains to them?
quotes.Author: Rose Kennedy

quotes.Quote: The Ney's cry is a call to the soul, beckoning it to return to its source.
quotes.Author: Rumi

quotes.Quote: Like music and art, love of nature is a common language that can transcend political or social boundaries.
quotes.Author: Jimmy Carter

quotes.Quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
quotes.Author: Lao Tzu

quotes.Quote: The earth has music for those who listen.
quotes.Author: William Shakespeare

quotes.Quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
quotes.Author: Albert Einstein
